tag_list: tlm, mobility-places, dorthy-com, saber-seven, fast-society, look-at-life
overview:
Jordan English Gross is a digital and social media entrepreneur who specializes in digital business strategy and marketing communications. His solutions have garnered him numerous awards including the 2003 National ADDY for Interactive Communication.

Jordan CEO and Founder of TLM. He is responsible for revenue, operations, strategic alliances, and all public facing services for the creative technology enterprise. In addition, he serves as a director and advisor to various technology and media companies in New York, Los Angeles, and San Francisco.

Jordanâ€™s solutions have garnered him numerous awards including the 2003 National ADDY for Interactive Communication. Jordan is the youngest person to ever win this award. He has also received various distinctions from the American Advertising Association, The American Institute of Graphic Arts, and the Print and Image Association of America.

He has been a guest speaker at various technology, social, creative, and entrepreneurial conferences and events. Jordan is a contributing author for ADWEEK, Adotas, and Mashable and has appeared on The Wall Street Journal Radio as well as various other media outlets. His most recent work has been covered by sources like The New York Times, Venture Beat, The New Yorker, Paid Content, Dow Jones News, Rolling Stone, Spin, MTV, VH1, and the Harvard Business Review.

In early 2007, Jordan founded a technology enterprise called Saber Seven, Inc. and Dorthy.com, which he quickly grew to have dozens of employees and over 200 collaborators. Jordan led the launch of the companyâ€™s first consumer search product of which The New York Times said, â€œcould quickly surpass those found on the first page of a Google searchâ€. Jordan raised over $7 Millions dollars in private funds for the enterprise and secured a venture backed term sheet for $2 Million dollars.

Jordan has visited over 17 countries and dedicates his free time to raising awareness around the need for new technology in third world communities. He has created documentaries about communities in the Kalahari Desert and Darien Rainforest.
